required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Abbott Vital® as an Alternative Meal to the Gold-standard Egg-white Sandwich for Gastric Emptying Scintigraphy (GES)
clinical_study.official_title: Abbott Vital® as an Alternative Meal to the Gold-standard Egg-white Sandwich for Gastric Emptying Scintigraphy (GES) Among Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This crossover study is designed to compare the rates of gastric emptying between two diagnostic radioactive meals using the gold-standard egg-white sandwich meal and Abbott Vital®. Healthy participants will be recruited and randomly assigned into either groups of Abbott Vital® and gold-standard egg-white sandwich group. The measurements will be performed over a 4-hour period using a gamma camera, and estimated gastric emptying rates will be calculated using established algorithms.

detailed_description.textblock: The gold-standard egg-white sandwich is quite difficult and complicated for staffs to prepare because the food needs to be cooked first and it will take time to prepare. Besides, the egg-white sandwich is not suitable for those with allergies to egg and bread and also to vegetarian patients. This gold-standard meal is also not a common meal for Asian people so some of the people may not tolerate with the meal. The aim of this study is to determine whether Abbott Vital® is as reliable as the gold-standard egg-white sandwich by comparing the gastric meal retention of both meals.

secondary_outcome.description: Time required by the stomach to empty 50% of the ingested meal (T1/2; minutes)
Intensity of perceived symptom and satiety/satiation based on Visual Analogue Scale (VAS)

arm_group.description: Egg-white sandwich is added with 1 mCi Tc-99m sodium phytate, then Abbott Vital® added with 1 mCi Tc-99m sodium phytate
Abbott Vital® is added with 1 mCi Tc-99m sodium phytate, then egg-white sandwich added with 1 mCi Tc-99m sodium phytate

intervention.description: 1 mCi of Tc-99m sodium phytate is added into the egg-white sandwich
1 mCi of Tc-99m sodium phytate is added into the Abbott Vital®

study_pop.textblock: Reference population is staff and students who are within the campus of Universiti Sains Malaysia and Hospital Universiti Sains Malaysia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal body mass index (BMI)
- Able to give consent
- 18 years old above
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vegetarian
- Allergy or cannot tolerate with milk, egg, and bread
- Participants with past and current history of chronic medical illness
- Currently on medication that can affect gastrointestinal function are also excluded
